Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: Roberto186338
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1am but were relaxed as we had warned the hotel in advance of our late arrival and had paid in advance. On arrival, the night porter told us that our room was no longer available. We were dumbfounded and after some protestation he made a telephone call to a sister hotel where there was a room available. We were then instructed to walk to the sister hotel in the snow. We considered this treatment to be unreasonable and a taxi was arranged. Although we were assured the sister hotel was of the same rating we found ourselves in a far less desireable area of Rome- tramps, prostitutes etc. We would not recommend this hotel as we would not want anyone else to experience the same treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Service??”
Reviews.Author: Parkholt
Reviews.Content: We have just at Hotel Galles for 4 days and in many ways enjoyed our stay. It is located close to Termini in an area with many small restaurants, especially one in Via Palestro where via Palestro meets viale Castro Pretorio is worth visiting. The hotel is clean, the breakfast is ok , we had jacuzzi, but here as in many other places italian service is more or less not excisting. The key to our room did not work. We got the impression they knew it when we arrived but they didn't get it fixed, so we had to call for help every time we wanted to go to the room

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good breakfast, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Pirringui
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by accident when we visited Rome. The staff was very friendly. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious. The breakfast had a good variety of food. The location was excellent because it is very close to the Roma Termini so you can take the subway to all the destinations in Rome and you can also take the train to other parts in Italy. Lastly, there were a lot of restaurants in that area which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Omg BED BUGS!!!!! RUN AWAY”
Reviews.Author: roel27
Reviews.Content: Whatever u do do not go to this hotel. My husband and I were brutally attacked by bed bugs. The hotel is dark and dingy and u don't realize these creatures are there. This was our wonderfully planned vacation and it ruined our entire Europe experience. Rome was our first destination and I first had signs of bed bugs and then he did a few days later. It was from this hotel because I saw a bug on the bed And just pushed it off, but little did I know it was bed bugs. DO NOT GOOOOO HERE WHATEVER U DO!!!! When I go back to the U.S. I will include photos. It is horrible and it was soo painful and lasted for daysss!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A no-frills place to stay that does the important things right!”
Reviews.Author: NanLaur
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Galles for a weekend in Rome. We chose it because of the proximity to Termini station and to a Metro station. It was clean and quiet, the beds were comfortable, there was air conditioning--what more could you want? Ah, the staff... Our first morning, we had to get to a meeting point for a tour very early and needed to leave the hotel before breakfast was served. Since the food was already out, they very kindly allowed us to go down and have breakfast early. At the end of our visit in Rome, the airport transportation we had arranged failed to show up at the appointed time--2:00 a.m. The night concierge tried calling the emergency number for us, and when no one answered and it was evident our ride was not going to show up, he called a taxi for us. We appreciate very much the friendly and accommodating staff! The only inconvenience was that the water in the room was not potable. But it's not the first time I've had to brush my teeth with bottled water, and we managed just fine. Hotel Galles was a no-frills place to stay that does the important things right!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, friendly staff, good location - Nice 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dansa3151
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights in April. I found it was all round a nice 3 star standard hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. he rooms were clean and classical Italian feel - so I got a Roman experience from my trip. Also, it is well located wihtin walking distance of many of the main sights and close to the Termini train station which is useful for geting elsewhere in Italy and is the main stop for open top bus tours etc. I will be happy to use this hotel again in the future and would recommend it as a good 3 star standard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value.”
Reviews.Author: Kevomcdo
Reviews.Content: Just outside the termini and walk straight ahead. Staff was very helpful. Rooms where neat, and classical. The only Problem was there was no extractor in the toilet and no available coffee on the table room. All in all it was well located, money well spent, stAff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “will only here again stay as last resort!”
Reviews.Author: apatel89
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a hotel (Madison Hotel) closer to Termini Station prior to arriving in Rome. Upon arrival we were told they had a group of 250 kids in the hotel and the receptionist suggested we move to their partner hotel. We didn't have an issue with it so we agreed. We had forgotten to write down an address for a tour we'd booked so we asked the receptionist we could get the code for the internet/computer in the lobby. She handed us a prepaid card with a scratcher on it that was already scratched out. When asked about it she said it should still work. Taking her word for it we tried to log on to the computer. It wouldn't work, so we asked her about it and her response was "sorry that's only for laptops" when we asked her for a refund and she said it was impossible and we'd have to buy another card for the computer in the lobby. Any other time we needed anything from the desk, the answer was always "sorry we can't do that" or "my collegue will take care of it" and it was never taken care of, even something as simple as telling us where we can get water (the water was unpotable in the rooms.) The rooms were decent, the bathrooms were small. The breakfast was TERRIBLE! The food had been left out overnight and the coffee was disgusting. The overall experience we had at this hotel was terrible. We wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MTraveler28
Reviews.Content: This dark, dingy and dirty hotel will make you regret you ever came to Rome. The "included" breakfast is disgusting, even the coffee is bad - how do you get Italian coffee wrong? The bathrooms smelled like sewer gas, hallways had a pungent odor. You feel like you are sleeping in a bat cave, complete with the dirt, must and smells. DO NOT BOOK WITH HOTEL GALLES! Its close to Termini Station, but you are better off spending 15 EUR and staying in a hotel further away from that sketch area.

Reviews.Title: “Irresponsible!”
Reviews.Author: varuniaf
Reviews.Content: Had confirmed booking from 26 May to 28 May 10 in the hotel, but on arrival were given this jolt that they did not have room for there was some problem. They did arrange for our transit and booking for another hotel, but then the location which had been chosen by us was not given. They had our email, could have always mailed us, but instead they chose to remain quite! Irresponsible

Reviews.Title: “Read the fine print before booking”
Reviews.Author: ErinandDon
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with my sister and her husband and intially booked for four people into what we assumed would be a suite with two bedrooms. We were so wrong! We were given a room with 4 beds side by side! We were so exhausted from travelling that we spent the first night in this room but in the morning we asked for two separate rooms. This was given to us on the same floor, but at an extra cost. There was no mention of any other type of suite. Apart from this we found the hotel okay. It did include buffet style breakfast in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: 1nka
Reviews.Content: Location: Quiet street, close to Termini Station, easy access to most of Rome's attractions. Takes a bit of walking to reach some of them (the Colosseum for example) but there's nothing better than a nice walk in central Rome, especially when the weather is nice! Rooms: We got a spacious room with a bathroom of good size and a charming little terrace. Have no idea about other rooms in the property, maybe we were just lucky with ours. Staff: No complains. Breakfast: Nothing special. Skip it. Overall impression: Good choice if you don't plan to spend the day in your room but still would like to come back to a clean and comfortable place in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with lots of room for 4”
Reviews.Author: MikeandGayle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Galles Hotel in late July and overall, it was a good experience. We (2 adults, 2 children) stayed in a quad room. The hotel was only a block away from a Metro stop, and was a few blocks from Termini station (easily walk-able with some luggage). We had plenty of space, with 2 fold-out beds downstairs and a queen bed in an upstairs loft. The room was clean and everything was in working order. The bathroom was a bit cramped for American standards, but nice compared to other Italian baths we had seen. The management and staff were all friendly, and the front desk clerk spoke good English and was helpful. Breakfast was nothing special, but was typical Italian morning fare. The only problem that we encountered here was that the water was not potable (small sign on the bathroom mirror), so we were sure to keep bottled water on hand. Also, if I were to visit Rome again, I would try to find a location more central to Spagna or Trevi, as that's where the night-time action is (and the Metro closes at night!), but for a good place to stay, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Will try not to go again”
Reviews.Author: VirginAddict
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for business for a couple of nights in mid-week recently, in Room 212. The room I was given was very spacious but with a dated decor and smelt of damp. The bathroom was huge but didn't have a bath tub just a shower. Curiously there was no gel shower supplied to guests along with the shampoo and towels. The room was clean, with wooden floor throughout, twin beds with a mattress softer than a waterbed which was very uncomfortable. The bed was mounted on large castors (wheels) and was moving as one turned in bed. The main problem was the old air-conditioning system which was working but very noisily indeed, which resulted in 2 consecutive sleepless nights. The hotel is located just by the metropolitana station ("Castro Pretorio") and therefore very convenient. Breakfast offered had a decent selection of danish pastry (brioches, croissants, cakes, etc.) as well as ham and cheese or fruit salad straight out of the tin. Reception staff can be so-so, some are welcoming while others are just unco-operative. Don't be surprised to find the non-English-speaking maid doing your room as you come back up to your room after breakfast either! You'll have to wait if you may want to brush your teeth... ;-) My conclusion: May just be OK for one night! But you still won't want to come back for more later. There is a very large choice of hotels in Rome and in the area nearby indeed, so make sure you pick the right one.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd2709
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a nice loaction. Not far from the centre of Rome (termini train station) The room I had was very big and had satelite tv, The room was clean and comfotable. I can't remeber the beds being changed often in out 5 night stay. I would return again!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: skiandmaura
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights. Booked there by CHA travel, a student travel group that also has adult tours. We were an adult tour. None of the smoke detectors were in working condition on any of the floors that I visited. All of the smoke detectors had their "guts" removed. When we complained to the management, we were told that it was o.k. because Italy didn't have a smoke detector law. I am not sure about that, but it didn't make our stay any safer. I would not allow my child to stay there, and we would not have stayed there if we had any other option. We did not receive our hotel itinerary until shortly before the start of the tour in the U.S.. The hotel looked good on its web site. Problems from the beginning. When we checked in there were not enough singles for our group. We had a number of single adults traveling with us. We were told that CHA was aware of the problem, but simply told the hotel to book anyone with the same last name into the doubles. That didn't solve the problem. The night manager in charge on one of the nights we were there was very obviously intoxicated, and smoking as well ( remember there were no noticeable working smoke detectors). When one of our group shouted at him to put the cigarette out, he put it out on the computer keyboard. Many complained about the lack of security. Many doors were found to be open when we returned from out day tour. One of the group complained that her mini-bar had been opened and all of the contents removed. She complained to the manager that she would not pay for the contents. After some discussion , he agreed. Many were charged for phone calls thay didn't make. We didn't find out about the charges until we were ready to leave for the airport when we checked out of the rooms at 4:00 a.m.. Our tour guide, who was excellent, told us just to leave the hotel as he did not want us to miss our plane. A person who was with another group was arguing with the manager about phone calls he said he did not make. I don't know how his problem ended as we left for the airport. Phones not all in working order. Some people did not receive wake up calls. It was especially bad on the morning that we left for the airport. Message light were on, but no messages. Breakfast good. Dinner poor. Good location near the termini. Very disappointed with CHA for booking us into this hotel

Reviews.Title: “good for the price...and large groups”
Reviews.Author: sjo
Reviews.Content: Went here with a big group for a college trip. The rooms wioth two single beds are small but bathrooms are really lovely and our room had a lovely balcony. The staff were helpful and friendly. Doesnt have any extras but perfect just as a place to sleep. I found the area very safe and lots of restaurnats close by. Try the Julius Ceasar disco pub round the corner for a good night out! Its only 2 metro stops from colloseum so good if you don;t mind being a little out...but not too far to walk back. Had a fantastic stay and love rome SSSooooooooo much! Go in off season though as this is much better and safer.

Reviews.Title: “they stole us!!!”
Reviews.Author: zeppos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel galles on october for 4 nights and someone opened our suitcases and stolled things from them while on the luggage room. it is not a safe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the hotel, the first impression was not good. An old building, in an unpretty area in rome. We change opinion when we got in the hotel. The stuff was helpful, the rooms were pretty good and very clean with all comforts.It is good for its price. The breakfast was excellent. The other room of our company was good but some comforts like air condition was out of order. It is near the train and bus cntral stations. We will restay in this hotel next time we return to rome

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: mort80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Galles for a week and had a marvelous time. I had a single room off of the lobby and it was a little small but I just needed it to sleep and take a shower. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The room was a bit used, but was well cleaned everyday. The breakfast selection was a little less than I expected, but was filling and made for a good start to the day. The location was only a few blocks from the train station, which made it easy to get around. I had a great time and would not hesitate to recommend it to others or to stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you do, don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Essexman_Abroad
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the glossy photographs you see of this hotel on the web, the reality is a poorly kept hotel staffed by people who have no interest whatsoever in making your stay enjoyable. Standards of cleanliness are poor, & if you have the misfortune to be allocated a room in the back section of the hotel, you will likely get a room where the air conditioning doesn't work, you will then spend a night listening to Rome's traffic through open windows. Other problems in our room were the security box not working & the hair dryer being broken. When you report problems, you are fobbed off with stories of "engineers working now" or "I will send a porter". Breakfast is another event to be missed, you are offered the cheapest quality food available, & the orange juice tastes like it has passed through the population of Rome before it gets to you. Admittedly this hotel isn't expensive, but if services are advertised they should be available. Next time we're in Rome we'll pay extra & stay somwhere nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome's great - Hotel is not”
Reviews.Author: Tony12-61
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel's position is not too bad, about 400 m from the main station (in the opposite direction to the sites), it does not have the facilities that are described in some marketing information. - the bar, such as it was, was never open - very claustrophobic lounge area in the main corridor leading from the reception - the restaurant is next door and the breakfast is basic to say the least - some websites decribe a pool; non-existent We were put in an annex building with a separate entrance about 100m from the main hotel entrance (real pain when it rains) - 1st room we had was great for size but the bed was up a highly polished wooden staircase, on a highly polished wooden platform - 2nd room was so small it just about accommodated the bed (don't complain at this hotel) I would not go back to this hotel
